column1: Who makes sure that every bit of text on a site, from long explanatory text down to the labels on buttons, supports the brand identity and marketing goals of the organization?
Who organizes the content logically and for ease of findability?
What shows the structure of a web page using only outlines for each content type and widget?
What involves the design of the entire process of acquiring and integrating the product, including aspects of branding, design, usability and function?
Who is the organization that oversees the development of web technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript?
Which protocol works in tandem with another protocol, SSL (for Secure Socket Layer), which needs to be enabled on the server for secure transactions to work?
What do you call applications running on the user’s machine?
What do you call applications and functions using the processing power of the server computer?
What do you call the sites where content and data is accessed from a database, and the final pages may be customized for each user?

What is the flip side of an approach to browser diversity called graceful degradation, in which you design the fully enhanced experience first, then create a series of fallbacks for non-supporting browsers?
What is a strategy for providing appropriate layouts to devices based on the size of the viewport (browser window)?

Web designers must build pages in a manner that creates as few barriers as possible to getting to information, regardless of the user’s ability and the device used to access the web. In other words, what must you design it for?
What refers to marking up documents in ways that provide information about the content itself rather than information about the visual styling of the content?
Which display value always starts on a new line, and the browsers automatically add some space (a margin) before and after the element?
Which display value only takes up as much width as necessary?
What are instructions that clarify or modify an element?
Which tag would you use when you have a long quotation, a testimonial, or a section of copy from another source?
In some types of information, such as code examples or certain poems, the whitespace is important for conveying meaning. Which tag would you use to preserve whitespace?
Which tag is used for introductory material that typically appears at the beginning of a web page or at the top of a section or article?
Which element is used to indicate the type of information that typically comes at the end of a page or an article, such as its author, copyright information, related documents, or navigation?

For example, books are divided into chapters, and newspapers have sections for local news, sports, comics, and so on. Which element typically include a heading (inside the parent element) plus content that has a meaningful reason to be grouped together?
Which element is useful for magazine or newspaper articles, blog posts, comments, or other items that could be extracted for external use?
Which element identifies content that is separate from, but tangentially related to, the surrounding content? In print, its equivalent is a sidebar.
What is used to assign a unique identifier to an element in the document?
What symbol denotes document fragments?
What describes how an element or group of elements should be displayed in CSS?
What identifies the element or elements to be affected in CSS?
What provides the rendering instructions in CSS?
What is the type of style sheets advocating for separate, text-only document that contains the style rules?
What is the type of style sheets that is placed in a document via the style element, and its rules apply only to that document?
What do you call all elements contained within a given element?
What happens when several sources of style information vie for control of the elements on a page?
What images (format) contain paths that are defined mathematically?
What attribute should serve as a substitute for the image content—conveying the same information and function?
What is the stretching of a cell to cover several rows or columns?
Which element is a container for all the content of the form, including some number of form controls, such as text-entry fields and buttons?
Which attribute provides the location (URL) of the application or script that will be used to process the form?
Which attribute specifies how the information should be sent to the server?
True or False | All form controls (except submit and reset buttons) must include a name attribute.
